properties.name: Sachsenplatz Dresden
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
The RV overnight stay is in a very central location on the Albert Bridge, just across the coastal road from the Elbe. In 5 minutes walking distance you`ll find the boat landing, the Terassenufer und the famous Elbe steam ships. Several playgrounds, restaurants, supermarkets, bank, post office and doctors nearby. Price: 10€

properties.name: Dresden Waldschlößchenbrücke
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Free parking directly at the Waldschlößchenbrücke and on the Elbe. During the day traffic noise. In the evening very quiet and the view from the bridge of the Old Town is especially the sunset just terrific. Bicycle and bus / tram in the immediate vicinity. 3 km to the old town and 2,5 km to the famous newtown "Dresden Neustadt".
date_verified: 2020-07-01 21:22:21 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Havenhostel Bremerhaven
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Hostel with attached campground. Perfect place after you picked up your truck at the port of Bremerhaven. If you sleep in your vehicle you park on a paved road. For tents there is a big grassy field. There is a power socket (long cord needed) and a tab with potable water. Clean toilets and great hot showers. As a camper you can use all the facilities of the hostel. Camping in the car is EUR 15 per couple incl power, wifi, showers etc. There is a restaurant, breakfast buffet is EUR 7 per person. Walking distance to downtown (20min). Supermarket right across the street.
date_verified: 2015-05-27 18:53:08 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Camping Sonnendeck
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Very nice campground at a little lake. Lots of permanent campers as usual but the setting is better than at other places. Grassy sites with power and water. Luxury facilities, hot showers and clean. Tent sites are right in front of the showers/toilets. Washing machines, cooking possibility and sinks for dish washing. Restaurant open for dinner (we didn't try). Good wifi (pay extra per hour). We paid EUR 5 p/P plus EUR 3.50 for the car (Land Rover size), power would be additional EUR 2.50.
date_verified: 2018-06-17 20:35:02 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Sora I Schöne Aussicht

properties.name: Stellplatz Schwindebecker Heide
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
A very nice and quiet, unpaved place in the Luneburg Heath (Lüneburger Heide) area. During daytime, used by locals and tourists to take a walk in the beatiful heath and wood area surrounding this lot. Overnight parking is allowed and the community asks to pay 3,50 (low season)/5,00 (high season) Euro at the Amelinghausen Tourist office. phone +494132/930550 Anyhow, the place looks and feels almost like wild camping - very nice! Fresh Water and tank dumps available at the sewage facility (Kläranlage) Oldendorfer Straße in Amelinghausen day and night.
date_verified: 2016-05-20 09:23:48 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Parking For Glacier
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
This is the parking lot for campers and buses for the glacier. There is a free shuttle that takes you to the top. The road toll cost 34 euro to get up here. We asked the parking attendant and he said it is a grey area but you can generally sleep here for a night and not be bothered. The night we stayed there were 15 other rigs. There are tons of campers and traffic during the day but quiets down at night. Beautiful view to wake up to.
date_verified: 2016-03-18 16:58:15 UTC

properties.name: Strotzbüscher Mühle
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Very nice campsite, romantic situated in the Ueßbach valley. The land on which you can camp belongs to the old Strotzbüscher Mühle, nowadays been used for touristic purposes. You can camp anywhere you like on the large field, with quite superb spots alongside the Ueßbach stream. Large (or long) vehicles may encouter some problems - or even might get stuck - when trying to reach the valley on the small, curvy road.
date_verified: 2022-06-13 00:00:00 UTC

From iOverlander:
Http://www.lenggries.de/sommer/camping-wohnmobilstellplatz-lenggries-fallsylvensteinsee Lenggries offers for mobile tourists a quiet night parking space in the district Fall am Sylvensteinsee. The Sylvenstein reservoir is a wonderful area for water sports enthusiasts and hikers. Facilities and advice: Forest parking without parceling and without lighting Sani station for fresh water and sewage (machines per 2 euros per filling or disposal) Public toilets No electricity connection Park charge: 4 euros per day Next shopping possibility 10 km in the direction of Lenggries Restaurant: Hotel Jäger by Fallkein Contact person on site, no information about occupancy situation Suitable for short stays Sommer und Winter http://www.lenggries.de/sommer/camping-wohnmobilstellplatz-lenggries-fallsylvensteinsee Lenggries bietet für mobile Urlauber einen ruhigen Nachtparkplatz im Ortsteil Fall am Sylvensteinsee. Der Sylvenstein-Stausee ist ein herrliches Revier für Wassersportler und Wanderer. Ausstattung und Hinweise: Waldparkplatz ohne Parzellierung und ohne Beleuchtung Sani-Station für Frisch- und Abwasser (Automaten je 2 Euro pro Füllung bzw. Entsorgung) Öffentliche Toilettenanlage Kein Stromanschluß Parkgebühr: 4 Euro pro Tag nächste Einkaufsmöglichkeit 10 km in Richtung Lenggries Restaurant: Hotel Jäger von Fall kein Ansprechpartner vor Ort, keine Auskünfte über Belegtsituation Geeignet für Kurzaufenthalte Sommer und Winter

properties.name: Abenteuer Allrad
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
This is the biggest 4x4 exhibition in the world with over 200 exhibitors. You find everything from camping tools and small roof tents to €500k 2-floor fully equipped trucks. It takes place every year in June during 4 days. Perhaps even more interesting than the show is the campground with over 3000 visitor vehicles. Any overland vehicle you can think of can be found here and all proud owners are happy to show you around. Camping is €15 per night, hot showers are €2. No electricity, no WiFi, OK for big rigs and pets. Small restaurant.

category: Tourist Attraction

properties.name: Rybnik Rožumberk
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Small parking space near the rybnik/fish farm pond Rožumberk near small town Třeboň. We spent one night off season at weekend. We've been modest, no camping gear was visible. It was nice. In the morning many cyclists and some cars with strollers passed by. They had no problem with us. They strolled the pond and were attracted by the snack stand/kiosk near there. The pond is very nice to look at but the murky water didn't attract me to swim. It was nice to go by bike around the pond. There is an educational trail about the history of the pond which is quite interesting.
date_verified: 2019-08-18 10:37:48 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Milesovka
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
It's a parking space at the foot of mount Milešovka. It was always ok to stay there one night beeing very modest and showing no camping gear outside (some people are living right there). At weekends and in holidays many hikers pass by in the morning to conquer mount Milesovka. Indeed its a very nice hike of 2 or 3 hours (plus the time drinking beer in the mountain hut). The parking space is also frequented by local soccer players and kids who use the various playgrounds.
date_verified: 2019-04-03 19:55:14 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Entrance to Hellersiedlung
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
This is an informal parking space for people who have their garden in the big garden-colony "Hellersiedlung". Be modest! Near there are two hills (one with and one without trees) to watch whole Dresden from above. At good wheather conditions you can see the mountains of Saxon Switzerland or even the first mountains of Czech Republik. Also hiking trails pass by. If you go around the hill (with trees) you pass the former military airfield of the Russian Army which is a re-naturalised nice meadow now. Also the gardens of Hellersiedlung werea military airfield before 1945. Near there is also the forest "Junge Heide" and the huge Dresden forest "Heide". Also near is Dresden's nightlife neighbourhood Neustadt and Industriegelände. Another possibility is the other entrance to Hellersiedlung on Magazinstraße (51.092302, 13.765152), but it's noisier because of the Königsbrücker Straße near there. Or you find another place in the quiet public street Magazinstraße by going more towards south.
date_verified: 2017-08-24 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Entrance to Hellersiedlung
properties.description:

properties.name: Magazinstraße
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
This is an informal parking space for people who have their garden in the big garden-colony "Hellersiedlung". Be modest! A petrol station is close by, maybe there is a toilet. Hiking trails pass by. If you go around the garden colony you pass the former military airfield of the Russian Army which is a re-naturalised nice meadow now. The gardens of Hellersiedlung were a military airfield before 1945. Near there is also the forest "Junge Heide" and the huge Dresden forest "Heide". Dresden's nightlife neighbourhood Neustadt and Industriegelände is also near. The Trams 8 and 7 stop there and go directly into Neustadt and into the city center. It's noisy because huge Königsbrücker Str. is near. Another possibility is to go the Magazinstraße toward south, it's more quiet there.
date_verified: 2017-08-26 09:49:31 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Tiske Stěny

Some hiking trails start there. The entrance to Tiske Stěny costs 1 EUR. The Tiske Stěny are beautiful sandstone rocks, a rare example of sandstone karst and absolutely worth seeing.

properties.name: Berli, Treptower Park
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Parking space for free. For old diesel-cars this is the last parking space before the forbidden area: the "Hundekopf", which is the wider city centre of Berlin marked by the circular line of the S-Bahn (Underground). Nearby is the S-Bahn-station "Treptower Park" for going deeper into te city. The river Spree is near. Some Trees and Bushes provide shadow. Somewhere in the park (closer to the S-Bahn-station) there is a public toilet. Across the (noisy) street there is the "Treptower Ehrenmal", which is a huge memorial built by the Red Army in 1945 in honour to their massive losses while fighting fascism.
date_verified: 2017-08-20 00:00:00 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Minicamping Het Twiskerveld

Good starting point for bicycle tours to Hoorn and Medemblik. Rental bikes can be delivered on site. Washing machine, dryer, general room, kitchen. Fee includes electricity and hot water. € 17.50 (2 adults, camper). Cash payment only. Open mid-April through September.

properties.name: Camping Veerhof
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Normally open from April to October, but temporarily closed when we visited mid-April. Unclear when it reopens. Phone numbers: +31 229 201 575, +31 640 109 281, +31 680 115 102. This campground belongs to the Dutch Nature Campgrounds Chain (Natuurkampeerterreinen - www.natuurkampeerterreinen.nl). Campgrounds of this chain have basic, but well maintained ablutions and are usually situated in a nature area. It is required to buy a EUR 15 membership card that is valid for a year and can be used for all 133 campgrounds in the Netherlands.

properties.name: Wedeler Wohnmobilstellplatz
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Large area reserved for RVs on municipal fairground. Capacity officially 20 units, but it can actually host rather 40 - 50. Open all year long (except when events or festivals are taking place). Electrical hook-up on 12 sites. Charges: €10 for RV; €1 per 6 hours electricity; €1 for 80 liters of drinking water. Free dump station. 10 minutes walk to city center and train station. The train takes you to Hamburg city center in approx. 40 minutes. 10 minutes walk to the Elbe river. Municipal pool and sauna opposite of site. The site is placed nicely and quiet in a green area of the town. The large open space may look a little dull and you could question the justification of a €10 overnight charge as the place has no further amenities than those mentioned above. But the town of Wedel offers a full range of services, supermarkets, restaurants, etc.. The walk down to the beaches of the river Elbe, a visit of the beach club "28°" or the ships welcome point "Willkomm Höft" is always worth it. The pool (indoor and outdoor) and sauna "Badebucht" opposite of the site is just great, both for kids and adults. And the train takes you in 40 minutes to downtown Hamburg. This may seem long, but there are only very few quiet RV sites available in this second biggest German town. So Wedel may offer a great alternative for your visit to Hamburg.
date_verified: 2018-07-11 00:00:00 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Kerkamm Weltreisemobile
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Jörg Kerkamm is a truly experience overlander, he traveled large parts of the planet in his own truck. Additionally, he has a long experience in manufacturing offroad vehicles. He recently decided to open this brand-new facility. It host a production site for offroad camping trucks, a very large and modern workshops for all sorts of RVs and a parts and accessories shop. Jörg and his team did a great job on my expedition vehicle. The quality of their work was excellent and prices were fair. They went the extra mile to come up with practical and solid solutions. Jörg always has an open ear for your questions and happily shares his experience with you. Should you need maintenance and repair for your offroad vehicle or RV this is the place to go in Northern Germany. Web: www.weltreisemobile.de Address: Werner-Von-Siemens-Str. 2-4, 25337 Elmshorn Tel: +49 (0) 4121 12 22
date_verified: 2018-07-11 00:00:00 UTC
category: Mechanic and Parts

properties.name: Porrentruy Castle
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Porrentruy castle is a Swiss heritage site of national significance. Construction of the castle took place between the mid-thirteenth century and the beginning of the eighteenth century. The oldest part is the thirteenth century Réfous Tower (Tour Réfous). Fourteenth century ramparts survive on the western and northern sides. Since 1271 belonging to the bishopric of Basel, the castle served as exile residence of the prince-bishops of Basel from 1527 until 1792. The bishops had been exiled from Basel during the Swiss Reformation in 1529, whereas they were able to keep most of their territories outside the city.
date_verified: 2018-04-13 00:00:00 UTC
category: Tourist Attraction

properties.name: Landgoed Energy Up
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Welcome to Landgoed Energy Up, The ultimate destination to recharge amidst nature. I am thrilled to share a bit about our camping and wild camping experiences here at Landgoed Energy Up, especially for those of you exploring the world with your campers and seeking a serene spot to rest. Nestled in a lush green setting, our estate offers unique accommodations such as yurts, ecoshells, tipis, and other one-of-a-kind lodging options. Our mission is simple but powerful – we aim to send our guests home with more energy than they arrived with. To ensure you get the most out of your stay, we recommend a minimum two-night stay for the ultimate experience. At our estate, you can immerse yourself in a variety of activities. Explore the stunning natural areas surrounding our property with invigorating hikes, or find inner peace through relaxing yoga classes. Additionally, we regularly host special events like sound bowl and cacao ceremonies, along with other unique activities to enhance your visit. So, whether you're looking for a tranquil camping experience or the thrill of wild camping, Landgoed Energy Up welcomes you to rejuvenate, reconnect, and rediscover the beauty of nature. We can't wait to host you on your next adventure! Warm regards, Jochem van Hessen Owner, Landgoed Energy Up
date_verified: 2023-09-19 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Zwiefalten bus parking

From iOverlander:
Ample space on gravel bus parking lot. Next door are football grounds which can mean some action or traffic, but it was very quiet. Nothing special or particularly beautiful. Restrooms (possibly even showers, didn't check) were free and open at the sports grounds and in town at the abbey entrance. A great kids playground and some fitness installations are right next door. 300m walk to Zwiefalten Abbey, 200m to supermarket ('PENNY'). The town feels cosy, has bakeries, a brewery and restaurants (including 'beer heaven'). The abbey is open, but currently under construction, so you can't really see much of the interior. Level, quiet, mostly sunny. Legal and free.

properties.name: Camping Land an der Elbe
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Great campsite for those who love nature. You can camp in a garden area behind reception - or on the other side of a dike on the Elbe River. The owners are very nice and live on site. They left the river side of the campsite as wild as possible with many trees. There are no specific campsites. You just chose a place. Not at all crowded on a week day in September. Campfires are allowed and firewood is available for purchase. There are nice flush toilets on the river side. You walk over the dike to use the showers - which are in beautiful, clean modern sanitary facilities. We paid €22 for two adults, our truck and rooftop tent. Showers are €1 each for 5 minutes. There is a grocery store about 5 minutes drive from the campground.
date_verified: 2022-06-30 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.description:

properties.name: theluckyvanlife
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
This is an official "campsite". No need to check in, just park if there is space. On the link below you can find all the infos (in German) - In case you don't speak german: short info - 3 days parking, free. Electricity, water etc you pay with coins. Toilets are at the kiosk, but they might be closed by night. Showers: you can go into the town swimming pool (pay for the evening ticket) there you shower. Only open between May and August. I'm not sure, but I don't think someone will recognize if you stay longer than three days. But we never tried out. Be aware: Heilbronn has the "environment badge" (Umweltplakette) - if you travel Germany you might already recognize. Here you need a green one. http://www.heilbronn-tourist.de/hn_content.asphmg=4xx44xx0xx0xx0&lang=01 ABOUT HEILBRONN: Enjoy the city, go for a walk at the riverside to town. There are tons of restaurant you can eat at. From vegan food at "Velo" & "Grüne Pause" to vietnam food at "My Sapa" or regular good food at "Charivari". If you are there in summer, visit the "Kaffeebucht" it's very close to this point. If you go out for a beer, there are also tons of bars. Young people really enjoy the "Data 77112". Lots of open minded people from all over. If you want to swim, the town swimming pool is also right next to this place. If you need groceries and daily stuff there are also many stores around. Best (in my eyes) is "Edeka" - everything we listed here you can google to find the adresses. Have fun <3
date_verified: 2018-09-26 00:00:00 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Camping Furlbach

properties.name: Park and Ride Free
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
MODERATOR NOTE: user reports "I stopped at this place on a Friday and soon they were full of cars racing in the parking lot and next to my car, I had to leave, on Saturday I came back and the party at the place was even worse with loud music, drinks and drugs, drunk people looking for confusion. Very beautiful place but I don't recommend it on the weekend where they use it for parties." 10/21 Large park and ride about 15 minutes by bus to city centre. Parking lot tilts badly but at the very top (closest to play ground) there are some extra long spots that are more level. Great playground here as well as a farm with animals to look at. Walking path around a few lakes. Bus number 18 goes straight to the city centre via the train station. It is free for 24 hours then ten euros, thought it doesn’t say no return so I can’t see why you can’t circle around and come straight back in.
date_verified: 2018-10-08 00:00:00 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Site Nationalparkzentrum Thiemsburg Baumkronenpfad Canopy Walkway
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
This is a dedicated tarred space for campers as part of the normal parking area with no direct amenities. Quiet at night and close to wonderful Baumkronenpfad (canopy walkway). It is flat 1€ exit fee (pay at exit boom gate) for a stay as long as you like. There are very clean toilets next to the entrance building but only accessible during office hours (roughly 9:30 until 18:00). There is also a restaurant at the entrance of the park (similar office hours, see above).
date_verified: 2018-10-10 00:00:00 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Brilliant little hideaway

Small dead end road looking across to the European Parliament. 100 meters to tram stop directly into town. 5 minutes wall to the Park de l’Orangerie which has several playgrounds and a small “zoo” and public toilets. It’s an unpaved dead end road with parking along the sides, don’t bother coming between 8:45 and 4 as all spots will be taken by people using the tram. We’re a bit over 6 meters and I defiantly wouldn’t bring anything bigger as the turning would be tight. But overall a brilliant find.

properties.name: Old military airport

The land owned by my father who is also a big overlander (1200gs) agreed to allow people come here. Place next to the forrest on a large meadow in summer with cows in winther with wild animals. Very remote place so Im sure nobody ever will come to you and you will feel safe and far from people. Its actually an old russian world war airport, but no no traces. Nice trails for bicycles and trekking in forrest yet forgotten by people. In case you need a water to drink, shower, toilet, swimmingpool, sauna or bottle of wine call me (+420725530234). If I’m around I will serve You!

properties.name: Campingplatz Tennefels
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Basic campsite with mostly permanent caravans. Flexible sites with space for big rigs. Quiet and attractive Black Forest area with friendly and helpful owners—speaks English. 23€ for 2 nights without electricity—2 persons and car. Bike path and stream adjacent. Grass sites. Upgrades to ablutions almost finished—heated toilet block and heated shower rooms with hot water in scullery, also heated. Walk to bakery/cafe open on Sunday. Enjoyed and recommended.
date_verified: 2019-04-08 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Camping Wangen am See
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Moderate size campsite on lakeshore—1/2 permanent caravans. Pub (opens at Easter, but can get beers, coffee all year)—restaurant at entrance open all year. Modern/clean ablutions, washer/dryer 5€. (Mostly) Gravel parking pads, grass elsewhere. Well organized campsite, somewhat small sites. Owner lives offsite, very friendly, speaks English. 34€ for car/2 adults 2 days, no electricity. Butcher shop 100m also has hot deli for takeaway. Campsite especially recommended if u want to avoid mega campsites on main lake.
date_verified: 2021-09-17 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: 1. REISEMOBIL-Stellplatz Salzburg

The place is 20 Euro per night, excl. electricity (not sure how much, we didn't use). WIFI is 2 Euro extra but really good 4G signal. Very clean toilets and showers. Portable water available. Also washing mashine and dryer (1 Euro per 30 minutes), open 24/7

properties.name: Naturcamp An der Weser
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Wedged between the river Weser and a small Creek (and busy road), and opposite a very large different kind of campsite (Sonnenwiese), is An der Weser: a small campsite with very spacious pitches and few amenities. Despite the busy and noisy road along side it, it's a lovely place with lots and lots of green. I recommend going all the way to the back of the campsite, as these are the farthest from the crowd that camps next to the river, and you'll have a small creek all for yourself! Drawback is that the nearest watertap is quite a long walk away and there is no power available there. Also, the toilets and showers are on the other side of the campsite. They are quite old, but clean. It is allowed to make a campfire, but they don't sell wood. Spend 2 nights here, one of them was quiet. prices are low: Camping per night Caravan €8,35 Bungalow tent €8,35 Camper €8,35 Extra tent €3,15 Person €4,20 Kids (max 15 year) €2,10 Dog. €2,10 Power €2,25 Car /Motorcycle €2,10 Boat €2,10 Wifi eur 1,50 I paid €25 for 2 nights, one person and a landcruiser.
date_verified: 2020-08-24 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Camping Pfronten
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Moderator note: please note seasonal closures at this campground. Check website for more details. Decent and affordable campsite next to a busy road and railtrack. Beautiful surroundings, though. Less than 1 km from border with Austria. Excellent base for hiking, biking, or visiting the castles of Hohenschwangau. (Fastest route is through Austria, no vignet needed!) Ablutions are clean and well maintained. And included in the price, just like wifi. Poor cell phone reception. Quiet at night. Quite large pitches. Electricity optional. No open fires allowed. Friendly and helpful staff. Small bar, no food. Camping prices  per night / day Adults from 16 years old 6,00 € Tourist tax 1,50 € kids 3 - 15 years 4,00 € Tourist tax 1,00 € Camper 7,00 € Caravan with car 7,00 € Campingspot with car 7,00 € Campingspot no car 3,50 € extra tent 3,50 € extra car 3,50 € dog 2,00 € Electricity 3,00 €
date_verified: 2019-06-24 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Bockenauer Schweiz
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Great campsite! No fixed pitches; you can stand on any of the 3 fields. The one in the back has (yet) no watertaps, but does have electricity. Sanitary building is also quite a walk away. That might be the reason I had the whole field to myself. Some small fishing ponds. Lots of shade by trees. Very quiet place! Fires are allowed. In fact, there are fire bowls everywhere, and wood is for free(!), but you have to saw it yourself. Lots of hiking and cycling trails in the beautiful area. Ablutions are clean but bring your own toilet paper. Showers are for free, as well as use of the washing machine! Prices are more than decent: €14 per night for one person and a landcruiser (no electricity).
date_verified: 2019-06-27 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Im Blumengarten

From iOverlander:
The city center, sights and leisure facilities are easily accessible from here. In the immediate vicinity are shops, restaurants, an outdoor pool and the leisure area on the Ikasee. The bus stop "Im Blumengarten" is right on the square. The pitches are available free of charge, registration is not required. For a fee, a power supply for up to 8 campers, as well as a service station for the supply of fresh water and disposal of waste water available. Showers at pool €2.. --- Das Stadtzentrum, Sehenswürdigkeiten und Freizeiteinrichtungen sind von hier aus sehr gut erreichbar. In direkter Nähe befinden sich Einkaufsmöglichkeiten, Gaststätten, ein Freibad und das Freizeitgebiet am Ikasee. Die Bushaltestelle „Im Blumengarten“ befindet sich unmittelbar am Platz. Die Stellplätze sind gebührenfrei nutzbar, eine Anmeldung ist nicht erforderlich. Gegen Gebühr steht eine Stromversorgung für bis zu 8 Wohnmobile, sowie eine Servicestation zur Versorgung mit Frischwasser und zur Entsorgung von Abwasser zur Verfügung.

A small camping spot between the „Rhein“ and a Lake. You can stay with up to 2 cars under 8 meters. 50 Meters straight on you can go right on a hidden path to the lake.
date_verified: 2020-07-18 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Free lake parking
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Approx 20 car spots for the lake. During the day you will find locals exercising in and around the lake and having a BBQ. During the night is quiet. There is flat grass for tents. There is a bakery and cheese shop 5min away, but otherwise no facilities.
date_verified: 2020-07-28 19:02:09 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Paved Turn Out between Tracks
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Nothing special, just a turn out about 100 m long, good for one night. Many rigs can fit here. We also saw a couple of people come out of the bushes with tents. It’s really close to the Zugspite tram and Lake Eibsee. It’s really hard to find free overnight parking in this area so this was a little gem for us.
date_verified: 2022-07-27 00:00:00 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Vlagberg Naturecamping
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Lovely Campside in the woods. Very Spacious and almost like Wild-Camping You can pick a slot with Power or without. Dogs allowed. Camper 6€ an 6€ per additional Person
date_verified: 2022-09-01 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Baggersee Rohrheim
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Several gravel parking spots. If you want shade go on and park underneath the trees. Be aware that in some parts swimming is prohibited.
date_verified: 2019-11-03 10:50:02 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Frog choir camp (moto only)
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Only by motorbike accessible. Try to find a entrance from the road and then camp where ever you want. Very secluded. The water is very clean. Getting in the lake is at some places difficult because of the plants and the ground of the lake (muddy). The campground is sandy and there is a lot of firewood.
date_verified: 2021-08-21 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Waldbrand crinitz
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Camping area right next to a “forrest” pool area. Kiosk with simple German food (very cheap) and a big pool with natural water. For non-Germans a very bizarre but interesting place.
date_verified: 2019-07-06 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Pirmasens Camping
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Friendly established campsite with basic restaurant and bar.
date_verified: 2019-07-09 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Landgasthof Parking Lot
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Parking lot connected to a very cool guesthouse and restaurant called Landgasthof Ropferstubm & Ropferhof. We asked if it was ok to stay for the night and they are friendly to campers, we even got a special parking sticker for our van. Parking was free, toilet available at the restaurant of course, but no other amenities. Restaurant is great, nice views, very quiet and out of the way. It is just a parking lot, so do not expect to put out the awning, table, chairs, etc. but it is a nice stop over on the way to some great hiking around Seefeld the day after :) If you need to go to the toilet in the wild during the night, be mindful and respectful - the owners have had some bad experience in the past and were a bit sensitive to let us stay there (we have no chemical toilet).
date_verified: 2019-07-20 00:00:00 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Schön am Fluss
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Cozy place by the river, Perfect for one night.
date_verified: 2020-06-20 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Stadscamping Deventer
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Small very informal camping right next to a river. Possibility to cross the river with a little ferry for €1 and walk into city center of Deventer. Clean toilets and showers.
date_verified: 2019-04-12 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Ahlhorner Fischteiche
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Great hikes in natural park. Average 2-10km. Different routes, color coordinated. Perfect for a nice walk with your dog. Free parking spot right at the beginning of the routes.
date_verified: 2019-07-08 00:00:00 UTC
category: Tourist Attraction

properties.name: Basis Camp Berlin
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Garage specialized in old Mercedes vans a.k.a. Düdos. Very experienced and friendly staff and lots of spare parts. Highly recommend if you drive an old Mercedes Van!
date_verified: 2019-07-16 00:00:00 UTC
category: Mechanic and Parts

properties.name: River confluence camping
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Very nice and tidy campground on the confluence of the Nahe river and Alsenz river. New owners, they make that place even nicer. Small tent (roof tent) 7.- Euros, 1 adult 6.- Euros Nice area for hiking along the water and with a castle and a ruined castle.
date_verified: 2019-07-08 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Quite parking lot
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Nice and quiet parking lot off a road with close to zero traffic during the night. Good stop for a sleep over and just a 5 min. drive from the starting point of the hiking trails up Hohe Munde. Mind that the parking lot seems to be popular as a starting point for cyclists, so the parking lot (free during the day too) will start filling with cars at some point in the morning.
date_verified: 2019-07-22 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Wohnwagenstellplatz Bautzen
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Free RV-Parking lot with water, electricity and dump station. Good for one night. Next to a big grassy area. There are toilets :-) 10min walk to the old town.
date_verified: 2019-07-13 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Wild camping
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Behind McDonalds parking close to an abandoned barn you can find different places to set your tent or even your car/van in the grass. There is a big field with wild grass. The McDonalds is open 24/7. There is also a petrostation and KFC close.
date_verified: 2019-07-23 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Camping Bärenschluft
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Pretty big campsite surrounded bij rocks (which can be used voor climbing). We paid €16 for 2 pers. + car + rooftoptent. Plenty of showers and toilets.
date_verified: 2019-07-24 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: layby rest area
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
In peak season when every campsite and car park is full and you just want to stop driving, try here. Its a bit noisy with traffic till after 2200, but then amazingly quiet for sleep.
date_verified: 2019-07-25 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Oedberg Alm
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Not a real campground but more like a nice parking at the Alm with Sommerrodelbahn (summer sledding), Kletterwald and playground. Nice toilets, but no shower. Very expensive: we paid 28€ for a Camper and family of four. Electricity, water, dumping of grey water possible.
date_verified: 2019-07-27 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Wittig Camping
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Parking surrounded by forest on gravel. Picnic benches and tables. Well with potable water. Just beside the road, but quiet during the night. No O2 internet reception.
date_verified: 2023-10-24 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Eichenbloch-Hütte
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Nice parking spot surrounded by forest, absolutely quiet. Wooden hut for shelter. Starting point for hiking tour to Herrenwieser See. We didn’t visit the restaurant 2,5 km up the road. There is probably another spot at the end of the road (3,2 km). No O2 signal at all.
date_verified: 2020-03-16 08:18:33 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Huzenbach
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Big gravel parking lot surrounded by forest, level. Very quiet. Access via narrow steep road, probably not for big rigs and heavy rigs with front wheel drive. Kneipp basin near by with benches from where you have a nice view over the valley. There is a trash bin there and you can take water from the afflux. Starting point for hiking tour to the wonderful Huzenbacher See. Poor mobile O2 internet.
date_verified: 2019-07-22 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Skihütte Martinskapelle
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Big flat area in the forest, in winter parking spot for the loipe near-by. But in summer nobody, but nobody was there! From here we visited the wonderful Blindensee (5 km one-way). When you walk to the source of the Breg (1,2 km one-way), you cross the European divide. We didn’t try the restaurant Kolmenhof (1 km), but it was well frequented. Very poor O2 reception. Trash bin at the hut. No fires. When you come from the direction of Weißenbacher Höhe, road width is limited to 1,80 m!
date_verified: 2019-07-24 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Gasthof Theresienhof
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Cheap 30€ for a single room with shared bathroom. However, DON'T go here because you want to Spend a nice night. It is only a solution if you totally need a place to sleep here. it is rather dirty, old and loud, Not recommended.
date_verified: 2019-07-27 00:00:00 UTC
category: Hotel

properties.name: Lubeck Camping Platz
properties.description:

Cobbled area next to canal. €10 Mon-Sat, Free Sunday.
date_verified: 2019-07-28 00:00:00 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.description:

Near railay, near small river, open ground for parking, no service, hiking trails crossig/starting here

category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Terezin Camping near Praga

*Overnight camping/parking is NOT available at this location. ..... Quite and cheap camping with electricity for camping and motorhome.

2 grass areas for camping. one small kiosk with beer and sodas, they also do hotdog with fries. A litle surfer feeling around the whole place
date_verified: 2019-07-27 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Schaliß-Steinort, hiking-parkinglot
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
This parking space is located directly at the schaalsee at the end of a dirt road, with a great, sandy swimming spot. There are picknick tables and campfire spots (not sure if legal but people did it). Also it has trashcans. It's not a big spot, two or three campers would have space. It's raining today but it would be the perfect sunset view. Also it's the hiking route parking spot for a trail around the lake. the schaalsee probably has a lot of great free camp spots and the lake is beautiful clean! totally recommend it!
date_verified: 2020-07-26 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Citti Park Platz

category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Shipyard carpark
properties.description:

Large level parking lot that is free to access. Just across the road is the entrance to the Alter Elbtunnel for free pedestrian and cyclist access to the city. Quiet over night, some early traffic noise on cobbled road.
date_verified: 2019-11-09 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Parking site - Dummersdorfer Ufer
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Do consider that wild camping in Germany in general is forbidden with some few exceptions! Gravel parking site for as many vehicles you might be. Haven’t seen any amenities around. 1 km down to the sea. Nothing more to say. We asked a local if it was alright to stay over night with RTT’s and a pickup camper. He said that he never seen any control from the authorities during night, so he thought it would be ok. There were five other vehicles than our three. Good phone reception, but very slow data reception.
date_verified: 2022-02-12 18:04:05 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Barefoot Path and BBQ Area
properties.description:

Path for barefoot walking, circa 1 kilometer long and well maintained, with water crossing and some other nice attractions. A place for BBQ as well. All for free. Maybe there is also overnight camping in a RV possible, but we didn‘t try.
date_verified: 2019-06-15 00:00:00 UTC

category: Established Campground

properties.name: Next to quarry pond

Nice place between an dirt road, quarry Pond and a hedge. Road Just used from a few people at all (Bike, Farmer). Had a Nice, undisturbed sleep Here. you can hear the Main Road a bit, but didnt disturbed us at all. we swum in the lake, Quite Nice temperatures atm. says danger of drawning on a sign, because the shore falls quickly Off. but If you are used to swimming, No problems at all. slept by tent and motorbike, was a good place. however 1 or 2 rigs would fit aswell

properties.name: Lohhütte
properties.description:

This is a great place to stay overnight with grill facilities. There is a play ground for children, grill facilities , wood at site, laydown easy chairs, and a log cabin. As we were here the log cabin was open. There is a fireplace in the inside and plenty of wood so you can cook/grill a meal. There is a toilet outside, however it is locked. This road is quite narrow, but transitable in any vehicle. There is almost no traffic and it is definitely worthwhile seeing. 2 km north of here there is water for cyclists on the left hand side of the road.

Nice site, got all facilities and pretty busy late August. Great location in the beautiful national park where there is lots of walking routes up the valley and direct from the camp site. Pricy, Eu 36 for 2 adults, 2 kids rooftop and ground tent for one night, but great location for walking is worth it in my humble opinion. Newly built, beautiful campground. Modern and perfectly clean facilities (kitchen, toilets, showers). Free wifi. You can rent bikes and kayaks for exploring the area such as the Geopark or Muskauer Park which are really close. The owners also speak German and are super friendly! Price: 15 € for 2 Persons including a car and a rooftop tent.

category: Established Campground

properties.name: Straußenfarm Mhou

An Ostrich farm in Germany ... Very nice and quiet place to stay with some spots even for bigger vehicles. There is a nice lake only 3 minutes walk away. Price per night 8 Euro, electricity 2 Euro extra. Toilets available, but closed, when the restaurant closes. Try the Oyster steak ;)

An affordable camping on the bank of the Klein Enz river. I have been told there isn't a price list, but it would cost 10€/person/night. For electricity there is another 4€ to pay. I would recommend this camping for budget oriented bikers. It is not very quiet during the day because it is near a main road, but in the night there isn't much traffic.

properties.name: Zernsdorf Green Garden

If you are passing through our beautiful village Zernsdorf and feel like staying for a few days, you are invited to our home and big garden. We have space to park your car and to camp in our property. Please, contact Christopher under following number 0049(0)1701855317 before hand for more details. Our area has to offer a lot of forests and fresh water lakes around.

Very nice and quiet campsite with little lake in beautiful wood. Good facilities and vegetarian/vegan restaurant. 20 euro pp. Very good campsite. Modern and well kept facilities, quiet and clean. Friendly staff. Price depends on high/low season, and type of pitch. Electricity and water tap at every pitch and included in the price. All pitches are quite spacey, but the pitches in the part called 'EIkenhof' are the biggest and most expensive, though still only about € 20 per night. Showers are very new and clean, but scorching hot at first and only luke warm after that. Very nice (though small) forest and beautiful small lake for swimming or relaxing next to. Wifi available for free at all pitches. Very fast!

properties.name: Outdoors Holten
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been iOverlander verified. By Owner: Outdoors Holten offers special overnight stays. In addition to our Scandinavian Lodges and Safari Tents, we have a number of camping and camper-only places. Beautifully situated in spacious places. Children and pets are also welcome on our 14ha estate. They can romp around in the woods. There is a sanitary unit on the campsite with separate areas, showers, washbasins and the option of emptying your chemical toilet. You are allowed to barbecue yourself (only gas). Coals are not allowed because of the wooded area. We are close to the A1 highway, so also ideal if you are passing through to or from Germany. For bikers, cyclists and hikers we have a separate site. Outdoors Holten has new owners since March 2020. Kim & Arjan. We cycled the last 1,5 year from Alaska to Patagonia and used iOverlander a lot. We are happy we can now add our own place to stay :-) See you at Outdoors. We’re looking forward to meet new overlanders.
date_verified: 2022-10-29 20:59:22 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Bergrestaurant Ahorn Alp
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
The Ahorn Alp is a summit in the Napfbergland at 1,136 meters above sea level in the municipality of Luthern in the canton of Lucerne and borders directly on the canton of Bern and the municipality of Eriswil. From the maple you have a wonderful view over the Swiss plateau and the Bernese and Central Swiss Alps. The Ahorn Alp can be reached by car from Eriswil and Luthern. ______________ Die Ahorn Alp ist ein Gipfel im Napfbergland auf 1'136 m.ü.M in der Gemeinde Luthern im Kanton Luzern und grenzt direkt an den Kanton Bern und an die Gemeinde Eriswil. Vom Ahorn hat man einen wunderbaren Ausblick über das Schweizer Mittelland und in die Berner und Innerschweizer Alpen. Die Ahorn Alp ist mit dem Fahrzeug von Eriswil und von Luthern her erreichbar.
date_verified: 2020-06-02 00:00:00 UTC
category: Restaurant

properties.name: Stellplatz Orpund
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
On Friday, June 26, 2020, a parking space was opened in 2552 Orpund near Biel. It has space for 7 campers, supply and disposal, electricity WiFi and a super good location. Price per night 20 francs. Electricity and fresh water costs according to consumption and information on site. For three months there is a garden pub at the square where various items can be consumed. In addition, the place is located on the Aare and is therefore ideal for cycling and hiking. The cities of Biel, Bern and Solothurn are easily accessible. Take the opportunity to get to know the beautiful Bernese Seeland on your trip through Switzerland. Coordinates: N 47 ° 08 ′ 09 “E 7 ° 18 ′ 28“ -- Am Freitag, 26.06.2020 wurde in 2552 Orpund bei Biel ein Stellplatz eröffnet. Es hat Platz für 7 Wohnmobile, Ver- und Entsorgung, Strom WLAN und eine super gute Lage. Preis pro Uebernachtung 20 Franken. Kosten für Strom und Frischwasser nach Verbrauch und Angaben vor Ort. Während drei Monaten gibt es beim Platz ein Gartenbeizli wo Verschiedenes konsumiert werden kann. Zudem liegt der Platz an der Aare und ist somit ideal zum Velo fahren und wandern. Die Städte Biel, Bern und Solothurn sind gut erreichbar. Nutzen Sie die Gelegenheit bei Ihrer Reise durch die Schweiz das wunderschöne Berner Seeland kennenzulernen. Koordinaten: N 47° 08′ 09“ E 7° 18′ 28“
date_verified: 2021-01-23 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Camping Berger

From iOverlander:

I was here in later September, it was very quiet but I can imagine it is crazy bussy in summer. Last place outside the cities limits for older cars without the right green stickers! Good place to cycle to city - 40 minutes. They rent out bikes. The fence is closed between 22 and 8 at this time of year. Nice showers, a covered cooking place, washing machines, some food can be bought here. 1 person + small camper costs €17,50 per night.

Beautiful parking place in the forest with a wonderful view to the landscape. Hiking trails into the nature reserve start here and a restaurant is nearby lokated. Good connection for mobile phones.

category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Mountain Oak
properties.description:

Amazing campsite with great grounds, facilities, extremely friendly owners, biker friendly. Nice views of the horses on the farm and there is a lake nearby for swimming.

category: Established Campground

properties.name: Minicamping en Kampeerboerderij Molenbroek
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Nice little campsite with a section for tents, park up the bikes right next to them. Owners are fantastic, I have had issues in Netherlands with a hammock setup as some spots refuse but this is one where they made an effort to sort me out. Facilities are good and the shops are close by.
date_verified: 2020-08-08 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Vent des Forêts - Parking
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
In the middle of a forest with more than 130 sculpture you will find this parking lot, where overnight camping is explicitly allowed. You can do several hikes, see map attached.
date_verified: 2021-08-19 08:02:20 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Hidden gravel area
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Big flat gravel area under some very impressive cliffs and completely hidden from the road. There is a barrier so cars/vans won't be able to drive in, but there's space for a campervan to park just before the barrier and you'd still be out of the way. Plenty of space for many freestanding tents in the main area. A bit noisy as there is some kind of industry going on not far away but noone around and a really beautiful private spot for the night.
date_verified: 2020-08-08 00:00:00 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Campingplatz Kloster an der Saale
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Beautiful place at the river Saale. Nice campground with all the amenities: toilet, shower, washing basin, washing machine - some things have extra cost, but not too expensive. Camping for everyone - tents, motorhomes, everyone on lawn. If you are lucky you'll stay just at the water. We paid 19 € for 1 night, 2 adults in a van, no electricity. Please note: check-in at 3 p.m., make sure to be early during summer time.
date_verified: 2020-08-10 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Volkswagen Kever Centrum
properties.description:

These guys repair any car, but are specialist in volkswagen oldtimers. They repair VW campers, vocho (kever, Beetle ) if your traveling with a Volkswagen these are your guys. If you have any other issue during traveling it think these guys can help!

No facilities, such as bathrooms or showers, nor is there electricity provided (a nearby campsite just one exit down the road does provide this), but great for a short stay away from modern day conveniences. Not officially a campsite, therefore very much wild camping, but perfectly suitable!

properties.name: Schattiger Stellplatz zwischen Gehnwald und Alfsee
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Moderator Note: The information for this Place has been submitted by the Owner/Manager. The information has not been verified by an Overlander. Our parking lot is outside the fence on our private land. The small country road on which it lies is hardly used except during the maize harvest. We offer you electricity via a cable drum and water from a hose. During the bright hours of the day you can use an externally accessible toilet with sink in the house. However, you should like dogs as our 3 welcome every visitor very exuberantly. For the 1st adult we charge 10€, from the 2nd 5€ cost participation per night, children under 14 are welcome free of charge. Unser Parkplatz ist außerhalb des Zaunes auf unserem Privatgrund. Die kleine Landstraße an der er liegt ist außer während der Maisernte kaum befahren. Wir bieten euch Strom über eine Kabeltrommel und Wasser aus einem Schlauch an. Während der hellen Tagesstunden könnt ihr ein von außen zugängliches WC mit Waschbecken im Haus nutzen. Dabei solltet ihr allerdings Hunde mögen da unsere 3 jeden Besucher sehr überschwänglich Begrüßen. Für die 1. erwachsene Person erheben wir 10€, ab der 2. 5€ Unkostenbeteiligung pro Nacht, Kinder unter 14 sind kostenlos willkommen.
date_verified: 2020-08-22 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Camping Schwarzwald
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
This hidden site is a gem for Visitors who look for a quiet stop to stay overnight. Attention: only for self contained Motorhomes with water/toilet on Board. No Tent Camping! What you get: Amazing View in the Valley. Sunshine till evening. Very friendly Hosts, do anything that you feel comfortable. Electricity and good Wifi at your spot is included. Also an amazing big "adventure playground' for older Kids... We stayed two lovely days with our MB 814 Truck. Please notice, there are only two, maximum three Places for Motorhomes ...they shouldn't exceed the length of 7m.. Attention: please send an email to the Hosts before travelling to them to checkup that a space is free. Email is : camping.schwarzwald@gmail.com and here the Website for even more Information: https://camping-schwarzwald.simdif.com/ You will get a warm welcome!! At the Moment you pay 10.- for the hole Motorhome with all People...for one night. Please respect the quietness of the Place.
date_verified: 2020-09-04 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Camping Municipal
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
The Langenwasen municipal campsite in Mittlach is located 3 km upstream from the village. Its land is spread out in a marvelous setting of unspoiled nature, in the very heart of the Ballons des Vosges Regional Natural Park. Renowned for its calm, the campsite is located at the start of many hiking trails. These hikes give access to mountain lakes (Schiessrothried, Altenweiher), to the ridge with its magnificent viewpoints, to farm inns and their traditional meals. FRANCAIS Le camping municipal du Langenwasen à Mittlach est situé à 3 km en amont du village. Son terrain s’étale dans un cadre merveilleux de nature préservée, au cœur même du Parc Naturel Régional des Ballons des Vosges. Réputé pour son calme, le camping se situe au départ de nombreux sentiers de randonnées pédestres. Ces randonnées donnent accès aux lacs de montagne (Schiessrothried, Altenweiher), à la crête avec ses magnifiques points de vue, aux fermes auberges et leurs repas traditionnels.
date_verified: 2020-08-27 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Weichelsdorfer Teich Parking Area

From iOverlander:
There’s a small parking lot next to a small fishing lake, enough space for a couple of camper vans or maybe one big rig. It’s not far from the A9, which is convenient but you can also hear the autobahn from afar. Otherwise it’s very quiet, you can hear the frogs by the pond. There’s also a picnic table and a couple benches around the pond. This was our first overlanding spot and we were pleasantly surprised by it. :) We are unsure if the authorities would have a problem with staying here, but we didn’t have any problems.

properties.name: Lake view

People are not allowed to enter the lake area, but on the parking lot you are legal. Don't make too much noise. This place is nice to stay for a night or for bird watchers or bird photographers. You can been seen from the next national road here.

properties.name: Parkbad Schwabach
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Here, next to the Parkbad Schwabach (public pool) and Hörauf Beer Garden, is a parking lot where camper vans can park/camp for up to three days for free. IMPORTANT: This spot is only for rigs with a built in toilet and closed wastewater system (I.e., you can’t dispose of wastewater here and there aren’t any toilets). A big rig could park here when it’s not busy, but would take up several parking spaces… not sure how acceptable people would find that.

properties.name: Große Höhe
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
The Große Höhe is located south of Ganderkesee and Delmenhorst near the Adelheide military training area. This is a varied forest area near the course of the Delme river. As long as no exercises take place on the adjacent military training area, it may be entered for hiking. However, you should stay on the paths and not take any remains of ammunition with you, which should not be the case either. There are several smaller and larger parking spaces for hikers along the “Zur Große Höhe” road. These are often very full on weekends. This is a popular local recreation area that is particularly popular on weekends. We start our hike at one of the hiking parking lots. Across the street on the other side of the street, a sign points to a nature and adventure trail. We follow this path initially. There is a lot on offer, especially for children. There is also a school camp in the forest nearby.
date_verified: 2022-01-05 00:00:00 UTC
category: Tourist Attraction

properties.name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Delmenhorst
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
The motorhome parking space with eight free parking spaces is located directly on the river, on the edge of the city park, the Graftanlagen, and at the same time only a few minutes' walk from the city center. The special service: You can use the disposal options at no extra charge, only the electricity supply is charged. Please note that the fresh water supply is not available until further notice. Boat rental, mini golf, the GraftTherme wellness and leisure pool, other leisure options and stylish restaurants can be found in the immediate vicinity. All you need to use is a parking permit (valid for one week, after which 10 euros per day will be charged). You will receive the parking permit directly at the parking space, on the box next to the information board. Please fill this out yourself and then place it visibly in your vehicle.

properties.name: Ferme Hohweid
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Idyllic, quietly situated pitch between a cattle pasture and a small vineyard on the Hohweid organic farm. One minute's walk above a private barbecue area on the edge of the forest, with a view of the Jura chain and sunset. Ideal starting point for hikes (Mutzbach waterfalls, Oberbühlchnubel viewpoint) or bike tours. Electricity and drinking water connection, benches, fire bowl with barbecue, WC available on the farm premises. Use of wood sauna on request. Direct sale of Bio Natura Beef. The "Glungge", where the films "Ueli der Knecht" and "Ueli der Pächter" were filmed, is right next to the Hohweid organic farm. In the cosy Glungge-Beizli under the old lime tree (self-service) you can enjoy snacks and drinks. By appointment only via Whatsapp/Telephone Open April - October 3 pitches

In theory you could go down on the other side to hide completely, however you wouldn't have the beautiful view anymore. Some locals probably made a campfire a few days before and unfortunately left some garbage. We didn't use the campfire and we would also not recommend doing so. People saw us and nobody said anything.

properties.name: Hostel Héctor y Clara
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Very beautiful and traditional mud brick hostel next to the Rio Grande (or so called Rio Secco), with amazing hosts named Héctor and Clara. A lot of huge cacti in the area, and a very interesting place to explore the Rio Secco and its canyons. Gabriela, the daughter was very helpful to find some stuff in Humahuaca. just ask, if you want to know more about the region, because Héctor also provides tours to the caves in the north. I had the chance to slaughter two goats for Easter festival. Breakfast, lunch and dinner were also provided if you ask nicely. we cooked some dinner for them, Iranian traditional food with German salad. price was 3000 peso per person. and a hot shower was always possible
date_verified: 2022-05-20 00:00:00 UTC
category: Hostel

Small campground with nice owner. Swimming pool, clean sanitaries, bar/restaurant near to a lake. 27 € for 2 kids, 2 adults, 1 dog, car and tent. 15 € for 1 adult, 1 motorcycle, 1 tent and electricity. Shops closed on a Sunday, try gas stations 12km to the north (25 min drive there and back). Nothing in the village but OK for one or 2 nights. Near a big road, so go to the end of the campground for a quiet night. It’s good if you know French. Receptionist speaks good English but store vendors do not.

From iOverlander:
Nice and cozy official parking lot for motorhomes. Located at the border of the little town Neuenkirchen. Close to the river Weser. Perfect for a walk to the river. A BBQ site and a soccer field for children is here, too. You need to bring your own grill grate to use the BBQ site. You don't have to pay fees here. This is an official spot for motorhomes, but unknown and hard to find. So you'll be alone here!
date_verified: 2022-07-16 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Campingplatz Stadt Köln
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Nice camping site at cycling distance from the city center. It is located right at the edge of the river, you have a nice view. The toilets and showers are clean. There is a cooking area with hot water, free gas stoves and benches and tables where you can sit. The kitchen area is open day and night. The management warned me of bike theft. It is pretty easy to pick up a bike and carry it across the fence. They have created a fenced cage where you can store your bike, it gets locked at night. There is a tiny store, I have not used it as there are supermarkets nearby. Minus points: - When it rains, draining the water away can be problematic, water puddles appear. - Even though the camping site is located at the edge of the city, there is a some background noise. There is a suspension bridge nearby with a lot of traffic. The traffic on the river is noisy too. Plus points: - Nice relaxed atmosphere. - Large trees provide shade in hot weather. - View of the river Rhein. - At cycling distance from the city center. Overall it is pretty good, It is a nice relaxed, no frills camping site. I have stayed there again (and again) after my initial visit. Campingplatz Stadt Köln Weidenweg 35 D-51105 Köln Poll
date_verified: 2021-09-15 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Parking area Hessisches Kegelspiel

RV park for 18 vehicles not far from downtown Hünfeld. The place is chargeable. The parking fee of 6 euros per 2 hours must be paid at the ticket machine. Possible payment methods: credit card, cash or via Easy Park App. Gray and black water can be disposed of free of charge - residual waste bins are also available. Fresh water is available for a fee. For each of the 18 parking spaces there is a connection to the shore power. The fee is 60ct per kilowatt. ---- Wohnmobilstellplatz für 18 Fahrzeuge unweit der Innenstadt von Hünfeld. Der Platz ist kostenpflichtig. Die Parkgebühr in Höhe von 6 Euro pro 2 Stunden muss am Ticketautomaten entrichtet werden. Mögliche Zahlarten : Kreditkarte, bar oder per Easy Park App. Die Entsorgung von Grau- und Schwarzwasser ist kostenlos möglich - auch Restmülltonnen stehen zur Verfügung. Frischwasser ist gegen Gebühr erhältlich. Für jeden der 18 Stellplätze besteht eine Anschlussmöglichkeit an den Landstrom. Die Gebühr beträgt 60ct pro Kilowatt.

properties.name: Overlooking Dieffenthal
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
I came upon this place when looking for a road to Chateau de l'Ortenbourg. The road suddenly became more narrow than I was comfortable with and night was closing in so I decided to find a spot to park. Right there it was, just to the side of the road, next to a vineyard, and on a 3 km hike (according to Google at least) to the Chateau. Space for 1 camper, also a big rig might fit lengthwise but might be difficult in the width. After that you should still have enough room for a tent or something. There is just one access, that's why only 1 vehicle. Great view, no motorway in sight, just 1 house right in front.

properties.name: ServicePoint

From iOverlander:
English: The best (mobile home) repairshop in the greater Bremen area! Super nice and absolutely competent owner (Christian Mühlner). We regularly had our car serviced there & most recently had our camper prepared for our long trip (from South America to Alaska). Everything always perfect. He is a mobile home owner himself & knows what is important. In addition, very fair prices & also says honestly if something is not necessary! He even has lifts for mobile homes. Absolute recommendation! German: Die beste (Wohnmobil-)Werkstadt im Großraum Bremens! Supernetter und vor Allem kompetenter Besitzer (Christian Mühlner). Haben dort regelmäßig unseren PKW warten lassen & zuletzt unseren Camper für unsere große Reise (von Südamerika bis Alaska) vorbereiten lassen. Alles tiptop. Er ist selbst Wohnmobil-Besitzer & weiß worauf es ankommt. Außerdem sehr faire Preise & sagt auch ehrlich, wenn etwas nicht notwendig ist! Er hat sogar Hebebühnen für Wohnmobile. Absolute Empfehlung!

properties.name: CP Sevenum
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  ----------- We have a beautiful meadow with an unobstructed view of the church tower of Sevenum and the horse pasture of the neighbors. It is a 20-minute walk to the center for local restaurants, 700 meters to the supermarket for groceries or delicious fresh sandwiches and 600 meters to the Horst-Sevenum station for a day in Venlo or Eindhoven. Furthermore, there is a wide possibility of trips to attractions in the area such as the theme park Toverland and Peelbergen Equestrian Centre. There are also many opportunities here for hikers, cyclists and horse lovers. If you have your own horse and would like to take it with you, it is possible to arrange a place in the stable or pasture in consultation with the neighbors. So be surprised and book a weekend away in Sevenum! But also great for a single night if you are passing through. We are a short distance from the A67 and A73. Perfect for... Hikers, cyclists and horse lovers Wij hebben een mooie weide met vrij uitzicht op de kerktoren van Sevenum en de paardenweide van de buren. Het is 20 minuten wandelen naar het centrum voor de plaatselijke horecagelegenheden, 700 mtr naar de supermarkt voor de dagelijkse boodschappen of lekkere verse broodjes en 600 mtr naar het station Horst-Sevenum voor een dagje Venlo of Eindhoven. Verder een ruime mogelijkheid van uitstapjes naar attracties in de omgeving zoals het attractiepark Toverland en Peelbergen Equestrian Centre. Ook voor de wandelaar, fietser en paardenliefhebber zijn hier veel mogelijkheden. Heb je een eigen paard en wil je deze eens meenemen dan bestaat de mogelijkheid om in overleg met de buren een plekje in de stal of weide te regelen. Dus laat je verrassen en boek een weekendje weg in Sevenum! Maar ook prima voor een enkele overnachting als je op doorreis bent. Wij liggen op korte afstand van de A67 en A73. Perfect voor... Wandelaars, fietsers en paardenliefhebbers
date_verified: 2023-04-07 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Les granges de Franould
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager. ----------------- Horse farm in the Vosges mountains. Small campsite, superb view of the Saint Mont. Possibility of meals for guests by reservation at least 24 hours in advance. Camping PRICES: 1 person €12, 2 people €18 then €3 extra per person, dog €2. (prices possible without sanitary facilities, contact us) Electricity and sanitary facilities included. For water and waste water you have to go downstairs at the foot of the church of Dommartin les Remiremont, there is a service area. The farm's water comes from a source that is therefore precious. WC access. Sheltered terrace with table and sofa. It is possible to approach the farm animals: horses, rabbits, goats, chickens... Ideal for a family with children, horseback riding but also on foot, by mountain bike because the forest is all around, campfires possible .We speak Dutch. Put GIRADCHANOIS on the GPS arrived at Dommartin les Remiremont.
date_verified: 2023-04-20 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Nemitzer Heidehaus
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
At the current position there are different points of interest: First there is the Nemitzer Heide itself. A natural habitat witch is either beautiful and kind of surreal at the same time. You can go there and visit it and have a walk into the Heide (stay on tracks - its protected landscape). Second, there is also the Heidehaus (food, water and drinks and toilets) and next to it a 24 hours parking lot for camping vans (for free) set between the trees. If the parking lots arend too frequented you can use a lot for camping with your tent. A natural playground for little and bigger children is there too. Pay attention: because of the protected landscape in this section lighting up a fire is forbidden!
date_verified: 2021-06-06 00:00:00 UTC
category: Informal Campsite

properties.name: Lost Place at Grabowsee
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Shortly before the Lost Place at Grabowsee is a great way to spend the night. It is advisable to visit the former lung sanatorium beforehand or the next day by prior appointment. A corresponding telephone number can be found on the Internet and on site at the entrance. Hollywood films as well as many German films and TV series have also been filmed here. The road has very little traffic during the day and almost no traffic at night. From time to time joggers or mountain bikers come along the way. You can also go hiking in the forest here. The street offers plenty of space to stand on both sides.

properties.name: Bivouac place

There is a source with NON DRINKABLE water. The place is spotless and there is a garbage bin to keep it that way. Only few neighbours passed by walking their dog and they were very friendly! Très chouette spot de bivouac dans les bois. Recommandé par un voisin. Il y a des bancs, des tables, un endroit pour faire du feu et même du bois sec et un barbecue. Il y a une source avec de l'eau NON POTABLE . L'endroit est super propre et il y a même une poubelle prévue pour que ça reste ainsi. Seuls quelques voisins sont passés promenant leur chien et ils se sont montrés très aimables !

properties.name: Camping Meier
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Small campsite perfect for cyclists ! It has everything you need (shower, toilets, washing machine, fridge, water, peace and quiet) for an affordable price (paid 9 euros for one tent and two persons). People here are really nice and you can also buy drinks onsite or order a pizza from a nearby restaurant ! There isn't really a reception or anything just someone living in a motorhome who will explain the things and collect the money.

properties.name: Heiner's Barn
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
After experiencing great hospitality on our four years overlanding trip, I feel like it's time to give back to the overlanding community. Feel free to camp out in the courtyard and share a beer by the fire during night time. There's space and some tools to do some repairs, wifi, a washing machine and a bed in a house if you're really desperate. I'm pretty busy building up a community supported vegetable farm. Feel free to lend a hand there or build some camp infrastructure if you want to stay longer. The coordinates given are not the exact place, as this is my relatives' and my home. But it's only minutes away. Please get in touch beforehand. A day or two in advance and I will most likely be able to arrange something. With a 10 minutes warning I might be somewhere else.. 01784792128

properties.name: Camping Waldberg
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Located in the middle of the UNESCO Rhön Biosphere Reserve, surrounded by meadows, forests and clear streams. A place for people who are in the mood for nature and yet off the beaten track – with a thousand options. Here you write your own stories. ..... Mitten im UNESCO – Biosphärengebiet Rhön gelegen, umgeben von Wiesen, Wäldern und klaren Bächen. Ein Ort für Menschen, die Lust auf Natur haben und doch Abseits der Pfade des Overtourism – ohne volles Programm und Tausend Optionen. Hier schreibt man seine eigenen Geschichten, ob ruhig oder naturwild.
date_verified: 2023-07-29 00:00:00 UTC
category: Established Campground

properties.name: Viewpoint parking in Grossalm Straße
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Little pull out on the side of a road with tree clearing that gives gorgeous views on the lakes, free parking, no restrictions posted. When we pulled in 2 other campers were parked here. During the day, the road gets somewhat busy but calms down during the night. Entire lot is on a slight slope but manageable. Benches as well. Only downside no bathrooms accessories but forest can be accessed. No walking to town unless on the road which seems a bit dangerous but it’s not too far on it.
date_verified: 2023-07-28 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

properties.name: Last free parking spot before Hallstatt
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
There are at least 4-5 pull outs on the way between Steeg and Hallstatt, some of which have bathrooms, others don’t. All are good for one night and don’t have signs posting otherwise. So you’ll definitely find your free spot on this lake. This specific one, has no amenities and is very close to the road (literally just a pull out) on the plus side it does have a nice view and is within walking distance of the town (though it is along side the busy road). It probably fits up to 6-8 cars or smaller campers/vans. I’d say bigger rigs are probably better off in some of the spots along the way before. Road is gets quieter after 9-10pm
date_verified: 2023-07-29 00:00:00 UTC
category: Wild Camping

Our philosophy Situated on the edge of the Soonwald, we offer you the ideal place to escape the stress of everyday life. Be it just for a weekend or a longer stay -. Relax in a peaceful atmosphere in our recognised climatic health resort and let yourself be enchanted by nature. Activities Hiking, walking or a long stroll could be one of your first leisure activities when you arrive at our place. From Weissenfels, which gives its name to the village, you have a fantastic view over the landscape of the Rhine Valley. To find out more about your leisure options, visit our surroundings section or take a look at our brochure. RV park Bad Schallerbach Paid parking space for 7 mobile on the outskirts of Bad Schallerbach. The pitch is located at a sports venue. Mostly flat, sunny place. Subsoil partly from meadow and gravel. Center can be reached on foot 300m. Serviced on site: Barrier-free, Dogs allowed, Electricity, WC, Shower. Activities in the area: playground, spa / health resort in 250m, designated hiking trails, designated bike paths. Included in the price: Water, Disposal greywater, Disposal chemical WC. PS: drinks in the evening in the sports home PS: is on a railway line = loud! Open April till end october. Dogs allowed , WiFi

properties.name: Eternahof
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Our family-run guesthouse offers horseback riding services and bicycle rental. It enjoys a quiet location on a riding stable with a farm in Lower Saxony, 5 km from the historic Bad Gandersheim in the Harz Mountains. You enjoy sustainable, regional food. All rooms and apartments feature modern furnishings, satellite TV and free Wi-Fi. The private bathrooms come with a hairdryer and free toiletries. At Eternahof you can also use the barbecue facilities and relax in the property's garden. The bistro offers a seasonal, regional breakfast buffet as well as cold and warm dishes. Packed lunches are also available. The Sehusa Wasserwelt adventure pool is 9 km away and the scenic Harz National Park can be reached in a 30-minute drive. Younger guests can have fun in the children's playground at our guest house. The A7 motorway is 8 km from Eternahof, and Bad Gandersheim Train Station is 6 km away. The property also offers a shuttle service to the train station and free parking. We speak English and Spanish --- Unsere familiengeführte Pension bietet Service rund ums Reiten und einen Fahrradverleih. Sie wohnen in ruhiger Lage auf einem Reiterhof mit Bauernhof in Niedersachsen, 5 km vom historischen Bad Gandersheim im Harz entfernt. Sie genießen nachhaltige, regionale Lebensmittel. Alle Zimmer und Apartments verfügen über eine moderne Einrichtung, Sat-TV und kostenfreies WLAN. Die eigenen Bäder sind mit einem Haartrockner und kostenfreien Pflegeprodukten ausgestattet. Am Eternahof können Sie außerdem die Grillmöglichkeiten nutzen und im Garten der Unterkunft entspannen. Das Bistro bietet ein saisonales, regionales Frühstücksbuffet sowie kalte und warme Speisen an. Lunchpakete sind ebenfalls erhältlich. Das Erlebnisbad Sehusa Wasserwelt liegt 9 km entfernt und den malerischen Nationalpark Harz erreichen Sie nach einer 30-minütigen Fahrt. Jüngere Gäste können sich auf dem Kinderspielplatz an unserem Gästehaus vergnügen. Zur Autobahn A7 gelangen Sie vom Eternahof nach 8 km und vom Bahnhof Bad Gandersheim trennen Sie 6 km. Ein Shuttleservice zum Bahnhof und kostenfreie Parkplätze gehören zu den weiteren Annehmlichkeiten der Unterkunft. Wir sprechen Ihre Sprache! Englisch/Spanisch
date_verified: 2023-09-10 00:00:00 UTC
category: Hotel

properties.name: Decent overnight
properties.description:
From iOverlander:
Decent overnight spot between the forest and some small buildings. From the main road going out the city turn right on the small asphalt road. There will be some parking on your left by the forest side which I didn't use. Continue 200m until your reach a house and turn hard left onto a rarely used road leading into the woods. Road has some overhanging branches my forester with two roofboxes fit, and I think bigger cars also will. But you will be touching some branches. At the end there is a small plot enough for one big car or a couple of small ones. Also you can turn around here. Spot is visible from the last two buildings, but i didn't see anyone and wasnt bothered. Slept untill 11:00. Good spot for how close to the city it is.

category: Wild Camping
